title: To add the Deposit permission:
instruction: If you want to record a customer deposit, follow the preceding steps but select the Customer Deposit permission. To record a customer deposit, see Recording a Customer Deposit.

output.meta: How should related articles be handled?

steps.instruction: Log in as an administrator.
steps.meta: Unsure: Don't know how to login (need to see the UI)

steps.instruction: Go to Setup > Users/Roles > Manage Roles.
steps.description: Go to the Manage Roles page

steps.instruction: On the Manage Roles page, click Edit next to the custom role you want to modify.

output.meta: How to pick the exact role?

steps.instruction: On the Permissions subtab of the Role page, look for the Transactions sublist.
From the dropdown list in the Permission column, select Deposit.

output.meta: How to pick the exact permission? Used second param to specify the permission

steps.instruction: From the dropdown list in the Level column, select the level of access for the permission.
steps.description: Set the level of access for the permission

steps.instruction: Click OK.
Click Save.

steps.description: Go to the Make Deposits page
steps.instruction: Go to Transactions > Bank > Make Deposits.
In the Primary Information section:
steps.description: Fill out the Primary Information section

steps.instruction:
Select the custom form for this deposit.

The system generated deposit number appears.

Select the bank account for the deposit.

The currency and exchange rate display for the account. For information about exchange rates, see Currency Exchange Rates.

If the bank account's currency is the same as the subsidiary's base currency, the exchange rate is a read-only field
The Amount field shows the total amount of payments, other deposits, and cash back selected or entered on the Deposits subtab.

steps.description: Set the date of the deposit
steps.instruction: Accept today's date, or enter the date of the deposit.
Select a posting period, if you use the Accounting Periods feature.
Optionally, enter a memo.

steps.description: Check the To Be Printed box
steps.instruction: Check the To Be Printed box if you want to enter multiple deposits before printing the deposit slips for your records. See Printing Multiple Deposit Slips.

In the Classification section, select a department, class, and location for this deposit, if needed.

If you use NetSuite OneWorld, the subsidiary defaults to that associated with the selected bank account.
On the Deposits subtab, enter the items for the deposit.
steps.description: Enter the items for the deposit

steps.instruction:
The Payments subtab lists all payments posted to the Undeposited Funds account. Check the box next to each item to include in this deposit.

You can filter the items by date, date range, or payment processing profile.

The Amount column shows the payment amount in the currency of the bank account, which was entered when received for a cash sale, invoice, or other transaction. If you must change the amount, click the link in the Date column to go to the source transaction.

If the field is empty, you must manually enter the amount. NetSuite does not populate the field if the payment currency is different from the bank account’s currency, and the bank and subsidiary currencies are also different.

If the payment currency is different from the bank’s currency, and the bank and subsidiary currencies are the same, NetSuite uses the stored exchange rate to calculate the amount.
steps.description: Select payments to include in the deposit
steps.meta: Unsure, please check this one. Do we need a for loop?

steps.instruction:
On the Other Deposits subtab, enter items not received as payments recorded to the Undeposited Funds account.

Enter the name, amount (positive number), account, payment method, and payment number for each item. Optionally enter a classification and memo. Click Add.
On the Cash Back subtab, enter the amount of cash back you received from this deposit. Enter the amount of cash you received, account, classification, and memo. Click Add.
On the Communication subtab, you can attach files and notes to this transaction.
steps.description: Attach files and notes to the deposit
Add a note to the deposit
steps.instruction: On the User Notes subtab, enter a title and note for any comments you want to add to this transaction. Click Add after each note
On the Files subtab, select and attach files from the File Cabinet related to this transaction. To upload a new file to the File Cabinet, select New from the dropdown list in the Attach Files column.

Use the Events, Tasks, and Phone Calls subtabs to add to attach activities, such as events, phone calls, and tasks to this transaction. For more information, see Attaching Events, Tasks, and Calls to Records and Transactions.
steps.description: Attach events, tasks, and phone calls to the deposit
steps.meta: Unsure, please check this one: I don't think we have enough information for this

steps.instruction: If you use NetSuite OneWorld and the Multi-Book Accounting feature is provisioned in your account, the Accounting Books subtab appears. This subtab shows the secondary books associated with the selected deposit, if any, and their respective base currencies and exchange rates. For information about Multi-Book Accounting, see Using Multi-Book Accounting.
steps.description: View the accounting books associated with the deposit

steps.instruction: After you enter all the items for the deposit, verify the deposit total amount is correct and click Save.

title: To edit a saved deposit in the Deposits list:

steps.instruction: Go to Transactions > Bank > Make Deposits > List.
From the Deposits list, click Edit next to the deposit you want to modify.
steps.description: Click Edit next to the deposit you want to modify

steps.instruction: On the Deposit page, modify the saved deposit as required.
steps.description: Modify the saved deposit as required
steps.meta: Unsure, please check this one: What can be modified?

steps.instruction:
Click Save.

If you modified the deposit amount, a prompt to unreconcile the transaction appears. Click OK. Open the correct statement period for the transaction and reconcile the transaction again.

title: To delete an existing deposit from the Deposits list:

steps.instruction: Go to Transactions > Bank > Make Deposits > List.
From the Deposits list, click Edit next to the deposit you want to delete.
steps.description: Click Edit next to the deposit you want to delete

steps.instruction: On the Deposit page, under Actions, click Delete.
At the prompt to confirm the action, click OK.
Go to Transactions > Bank > Transfer Funds.
steps.description: Go to the Transfer Funds page

steps.instruction:
In the From Account field, select the source account containing the funds that you want to transfer.

The balance of this account and its currency denomination appear next to the From Account field.
steps.description: Select the source account containing the funds that you want to transfer

steps.instruction:
In the To Account field, select the target account to receive the funds.

The balance of this account and its currency denomination appear next to the To Account field. The Exchange Rate between the currencies in the two accounts displays below the two currency denominations.
steps.description: Select the target account to receive the funds

steps.instruction:
Select the posting period for this transfer.

The period must be an open period.
steps.description: Select the posting period for this transfer

steps.instruction: Accept or select the date in the Date field.
steps.description: Accept or select the date in the Date field

steps.instruction:
In the top Amount field, enter the amount of funds, in the account's currency, to be transferred from the account identified in the From Account field.

The second Amount field displays the amount to be transferred into the account identified in the To Account field, after currency translation.
steps.description: Enter the amount of funds to transfer

steps.instruction: Enter an optional memo.
Enter a department, class, or location if appropriate.
steps.description: Enter a department, class, or location if appropriate

steps.instruction: Click Save.

title: To record cash back from a deposit:
description: How to record cash back from a deposit

steps.instruction: Go to Transactions > Bank > Make Deposits.
Create a deposit. For more information, see Making Deposits.
steps.meta: Do we want to have an action for going to another page? Can produce loops. But, too much involved for this 1 step otherwise.

steps.instruction: Click the Cash Back subtab.
In the Amount field, enter the amount of cash you got back.
steps.description: Enter the amount of cash you got back

steps.instruction: Select the account the deposit comes from.
steps.description: Select the account the deposit comes from

steps.instruction: Select a department, class or location.
steps.description: Select a department, class or location

steps.instruction: Enter an optional memo.

Click Add.

Repeat the steps above for any other cash items you received from deposits.
steps.meta: Do we want a looping action?

steps.instruction: Click Save.
Go to Transactions > Bank > Write Checks > List.
steps.description: Go to Transactions > Bank > Write Checks > List

steps.instruction: Click the Edit link for the check to be voided.
steps.description: Click the Edit link for the check to be voided

steps.instruction:
Click Void.

If you are voiding this check with a reversing journal entry, the Voiding Journal page appears. Click Save.

The system sets the check’s status to Voided and records a journal entry with an opposite amount that cancels out the general ledger impact of the check. For more information on creating a journal entry, see Making Journal Entries.

If you are voiding this check without a reversing journal entry, the system sets the status to Voided and sets the transaction amount to zero. If the check was previously cleared, a confirmation window appears warning you that voiding the check may cause an inconsistency in your account reconciliation, like an incorrect balance. The check becomes unreconciled if previously reconciled, and the check is unmatched or has its cleared status removed. You can click Cancel to not void the check or click OK to void the check.
steps.meta: Currently choosing one thing, but there are two options. Do we want to have a branching action?

steps.instruction: Go to Lists > Accounting > Accounts, or Setup > Accounting > Chart of Accounts.
steps.description: Go to Lists > Accounting > Accounts, or Setup > Accounting > Chart of Accounts
steps.meta: Currently choosing one thing, but there are two options. Do we want to have a branching action?

steps.instruction: In the list of accounts, click Edit next to the bank account for which you want to reset check numbering.
steps.description: Click Edit next to the account

steps.instruction: In the Next Check Number field, enter the check number to use for the next check written from this account.
Click Save.
Go to Transactions > Bank > Write Checks.
On the Check page, verify that the correct bank account appears in the Account field.
steps.meta: Should this do anything? Thought no, but it could focus the field

steps.instruction: Enter the payment information in the appropriate fields.
steps.meta: Do we want to reference another action here? Otherwise, we need to add a lot of steps, and I don't know what's involved

steps.instruction: In the Check Number field, enter Debit or other text to indicate that the payment is not made by a check.
steps.description: Enter Debit in Check Number field

output.meta: Using second param as text to type

steps.instruction:
Click Save.

This debit appears on the register for the account.

title: To enter non-cash debit transactions while reconciling a bank statement:
description: How to enter non-cash debit transactions while reconciling a bank statement

steps.instruction: Go to Transactions > Bank > Reconcile Bank Statement.
steps.description: Go to Reconcile Bank Statement Page

steps.instruction: Click the New Charges subtab.
Fill in the appropriate information for the charge.
Click Add.

Complete the rest of the reconciliation.

For complete reconciliation instructions, see Reconciling Bank Statements.

When you have cleared all the transactions listed on the statement and entered any additional transactions, the statement balance and cleared balance should match. Use the Difference field to track your progress.
steps.meta: Unknown: Reconciliation instructions, reference to Reconciling Bank Statements

steps.instruction:
When finished, you can:

  • Click Save to reconcile your bank statement.

  • Click Save & Print to save and print your reconciliation.

  • Click Hold to hold your reconciliation until you return to save or print it.
steps.description: Click Save, Save & Print, or Hold

title: To delete a funds transfer:
description: How to delete a funds transfer

steps.instruction: Go to Transactions > Bank > Transfer Funds > List.
steps.description: Go to Transfer Funds List Page

steps.instruction: From the Transfers list, click Edit next to the funds transfer you want to delete.
steps.description: Click Edit next to funds transfer
steps.meta: Relative positioning? How do we know which funds transfer to delete?

steps.instruction: On the Transfer page, under Actions, click Delete.
At the prompt to confirm the action, click OK.

title: To add a new company credit card account:

steps.instruction: Go to Setup > Accounting > Manage G/L > Chart of Accounts > New.
In the Type list, select Credit Card.
Enter the number to identify this account.
Enter a name for the account.
Complete other fields as needed.

If you use NetSuite OneWorld, choose the subsidiary to which this credit card should be assigned.

Credit card accounts can be assigned to only one subsidiary.
Click Save.

title: To modify an existing company credit card account:

steps.instruction: Go to Setup > Accounting > Manage G/L > Chart of Accounts.
From the Chart of Accounts, click Edit next to the credit card account you want to modify.

Modify the fields as needed.

You cannot change the currency associated with the account because transactions in this currency exist in the system.

From the Actions menu you can delete the company credit card account or merge the account into another company credit card account.
Click Save.
